sentences.sContent: The thirty-two chapters of a novel — if we consider how to read a novel first — are an attempt to make something as formed and controlled as a building: but words are more impalpable than bricks;
sentences.sContent_eng: The thirty-two chapters of a novel — if we consider how to read a novel first — are an attempt to make something as formed and controlled as a building: but words are more impalpable than bricks;
sentences.sCn: 一部小说——如果我们先考虑一下怎样阅读小说的话——要有32个章节，这道理实际上跟建造有形有状的楼房完全一样：只不文字不像砖块看得见摸得着；

synos.tran: 感触不到的；难理解的；无形的

remMethod.val: + palpable (可触摸的) → 不可触摸的 → 感触不到的， 摸不到的

words.tran: 不能触觉或感知的状态或性质

trans.tranCn: 感触不到的， 摸不到的
trans.tranOther: impossible to touch or feel physically
